title: How to Make Viennese Biscuits

steps.headline: Place the chocolate into the bain marie (double boiler).
steps.description: Melt the chocolate over gentle heat.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 170ºC/325ºF.
steps.description: Lay the baking (parchment) on the baking tray (sheet).

steps.headline: Mix together the butter and sugar until smooth.
Sift the flour, cornflour and baking powder.
steps.description: Pour the sifted mixture into the blended butter and sugar mix.

steps.headline: Pour in the milk and then the melted chocolate.
Fill the piping bag with the Viennese biscuit piping piece on the end.
Pipe the dough onto the baking tray (sheet).
steps.description: Form them by doing a zigzag shape on the tray.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Allow to cool on a wire cooling rack.

steps.headline: Serve when cooled down.
steps.description: If wished, you can dip one end of each biscuit in melted chocolate and allow it to set before serving.

text: Place the chocolate into the bain marie (double boiler). Melt the chocolate over gentle heat. Preheat the oven to 170ºC/325ºF. Lay the baking (parchment) on the baking tray (sheet). Mix together the butter and sugar until smooth.  Sift the flour, cornflour and baking powder. Pour the sifted mixture into the blended butter and sugar mix. Pour in the milk and then the melted chocolate. Mix through. Fill the piping bag with the Viennese biscuit piping piece on the end.  Pipe the dough onto the baking tray (sheet). Form them by doing a zigzag shape on the tray. Place in the oven. Bake for around 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from the oven. Allow to cool on a wire cooling rack. Serve when cooled down. If wished, you can dip one end of each biscuit in melted chocolate and allow it to set before serving.
